file.title: BOM Review
file.bullet: What is the BOM?
Browser Object Model
What is it use to do?
Control the browser and get information from the browser.
What is the top level node of the BOM?
The window.
Do you have to use window to call system dialogs like alert(), confirm(), or prompt()?
No. Since the window object represents the global JavaScript object, the methods can be called directly without mentioning the window object.
What does setInterval(f, i) do?
It allows code to be executed at a specified time interval.
What method cancels the interval code execution?
The method clearInterval()
How can we delay the execution of a function for a specified amount of time?
The setTimeout(f, i) method delays the execution of as function for a specified time interval.
After setting the time delay, can we still stop the method from being invoked?
Yes. The timeout code execution can be cancelled by calling clearTimeout() method.
What unit of time do setInterval(f, i) and setTimeout(f, i) use to set the time intervals?
milliseconds (1/1000th of a second)
How do we change the browser's location using the BOM window?
We set the location value; window.location = 'http://www.google.com';
How do we reload the current page possibly using the cache?
We use reload() without any arguments, "location.reload();"
How do we reload the current page specifically using the server?
We use reload() with the boolean true as an argument, "location.reload(true);"
